00021 
00022 #ifndef VMI_DBG_H
00023 #define VMI_DBG_H
00024 
00025 #include "vmi/simAddrTypes.h"
00026 #include "vmi/vmiTypes.h"
00027 #include "vmi/vmiTyperefs.h"
00028 
00029 
00030 //
00031 // Type of function called by the debugger to read a register
00032 // Return code indicates whether the read succeeded.
00033 //
00034 // The endianness of the returned data should be that of the host.
00035 //
00036 #define VMI_REG_READ_FN(_NAME) Bool _NAME( \
00037     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00038     vmiRegInfoCP  reg,          \
00039     void         *buffer        \
00040 )
00041 typedef VMI_REG_READ_FN((*vmiRegReadFn));
00042 
00043 //
00044 // Type of function called by the debugger to write a register
00045 // Return code indicates whether the write succeeded
00046 //
00047 // The endianness of the supplied data should be that of the host.
00048 //
00049 #define VMI_REG_WRITE_FN(_NAME) Bool _NAME( \
00050     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00051     vmiRegInfoCP  reg,          \
00052     const void   *buffer        \
00053 )
00054 typedef VMI_REG_WRITE_FN((*vmiRegWriteFn));
00055 
00056 //
00057 // Function type used to emit instruction trace for the passed simulated
00058 // address
00059 //
00060 #define VMI_TRACE_FN(_NAME) Bool _NAME( \
00061     vmiProcessorP processor,        \
00062     Addr          simAddress,       \
00063     Bool          isException,      \
00064     Bool          isFirst,          \
00065     Bool          isRegisterIntro   \
00066 )
00067 typedef VMI_TRACE_FN((*vmiTraceFn));
00068 
00069 //
00070 // Function type used to dump processor register state
00071 //
00072 #define VMI_DEBUG_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00073     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00074     Bool          isTrace,      \
00075     Bool          isException,  \
00076     Bool          isFirst       \
00077 )
00078 typedef VMI_DEBUG_FN((*vmiDebugFn));
00079 
00080 //
00081 // Type of function called by the debugger to obtain information about the
00082 // register groups in the simulated processor
00083 //
00084 #define VMI_REG_GROUP_FN(_NAME) vmiRegGroupCP _NAME( \
00085     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00086     vmiRegGroupCP prev          \
00087 )
00088 typedef VMI_REG_GROUP_FN((*vmiRegGroupFn));
00089 
00090 //
00091 // Type of function called by the debugger to obtain information about the
00092 // registers in the simulated processor
00093 //
00094 #define VMI_REG_INFO_FN(_NAME) vmiRegInfoCP _NAME( \
00095     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00096     vmiRegInfoCP  prev,         \
00097     Bool          gdbFrame      \
00098 )
00099 typedef VMI_REG_INFO_FN((*vmiRegInfoFn));
00100 
00101 //
00102 // Type of function called by the debugger to obtain information about the
00103 // exceptions in the simulated processor
00104 //
00105 #define VMI_EXCEPTION_INFO_FN(_NAME) vmiExceptionInfoCP _NAME( \
00106     vmiProcessorP      processor,   \
00107     vmiExceptionInfoCP prev         \
00108 )
00109 typedef VMI_EXCEPTION_INFO_FN((*vmiExceptionInfoFn));
00110 
00111 //
00112 // Type of function called by the debugger to obtain information about the
00113 // current processor exception
00114 //
00115 #define VMI_GET_EXCEPTION_FN(_NAME) vmiExceptionInfoCP _NAME( \
00116     vmiProcessorP processor \
00117 )
00118 typedef VMI_GET_EXCEPTION_FN((*vmiGetExceptionFn));
00119 
00120 //
00121 // Type of function called by the debugger to obtain information about the
00122 // modes in the simulated processor
00123 //
00124 #define VMI_MODE_INFO_FN(_NAME) vmiModeInfoCP _NAME( \
00125     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00126     vmiModeInfoCP prev          \
00127 )
00128 typedef VMI_MODE_INFO_FN((*vmiModeInfoFn));
00129 
00130 //
00131 // Type of function called by the debugger to obtain information about the
00132 // current processor mode
00133 //
00134 #define VMI_GET_MODE_FN(_NAME) vmiModeInfoCP _NAME(vmiProcessorP processor)
00135 typedef VMI_GET_MODE_FN((*vmiGetModeFn));
00136 
00137 //
00138 // This type is used to indicate the group to which a register belongs (for
00139 // organizational purposes in a debugger)
00140 //
00141 typedef struct vmiRegGroupS {
00142     const char *name;           // register group name
00143 } vmiRegGroup;
00144 
00145 //
00146 // Enumeration of register usage
00147 //
00148 typedef enum {
00149     vmi_REG_NONE = 0,           // no special usage for this register
00150     vmi_REG_PC   = 1,           // register is the program counter
00151     vmi_REG_SP   = 2,           // register is the stack pointer
00152     vmi_REG_FP   = 3            // register is the frame pointer
00153 } vmiRegUsage;
00154 
00155 //
00156 // Enumeration of register access
00157 //
00158 typedef enum {
00159     vmi_RA_NONE = 0x0,          // no register access
00160     vmi_RA_R    = 0x1,          // register is read-only
00161     vmi_RA_W    = 0x2,          // register is write-only
00162     vmi_RA_RW   = 0x3           // register is read/write
00163 } vmiRegAccess;
00164 
00165 //
00166 // Structure used to pass information about the registers in a simulated
00167 // processor to the debugger
00168 //
00169 typedef struct vmiRegInfoS {
00170     const char   *name;                 // register identification name
00171     const char   *description;          // description string
00172     vmiRegGroupCP group;                // group for this register
00173     Uns32         gdbIndex;             // gdb ordinal index number
00174     vmiRegUsage   usage         :  2;   // any special usage for this register
00175     vmiRegAccess  access        :  2;   // allowed access
00176     Bool          noSaveRestore :  1;   // does not participate in save/restore
00177     Bool          noTraceChange :  1;   // does not participate in tracing
00178     Uns32         unused        : 10;   // unused fields
00179     Uns32         bits          : 16;   // size of register in bits
00180     vmiRegReadFn  readCB;               // read callback function
00181     vmiRegWriteFn writeCB;              // write callback function
00182     vmiReg        raw;                  // raw register value (if no callback)
00183     void         *userData;             // model-specific data pointer
00184 } vmiRegInfo;
00185 
00186 //
00187 // Special readCB and writeCB values specifying that read and write of raw
00188 // register values is allowed (i.e. without callback), requiring that either:
00189 // 1. the 'raw' field is set with the appropriate register; or:
00190 // 2. the userData argument is set to the register offset in the processor
00191 //    structure (deprecated backwards-compatible mode).
00192 // With the introduction of the 'raw' field in the vmiRegInfo structure, these
00193 // special values are not required (specify the 'raw' vmiReg and omit the the
00194 // read/write callback to achieve the same effect).
00195 //
00196 #define VMI_REG_RAW_READ_CB  ((vmiRegReadFn)(-1))
00197 #define VMI_REG_RAW_WRITE_CB ((vmiRegWriteFn)(-1))
00198 
00199 //
00200 // Define plain read/write register in processor
00201 //
00202 #define VMI_REG_RAW_RW(_TP, _F) { \
00203     name   : #_F,                       \
00204     access : vmi_RA_RW,                 \
00205     bits   : sizeof(((_TP)0)->_F)*8,    \
00206     raw    : VMI_CPU_REG(_TP, _F)       \
00207 }
00208 
00209 //
00210 // Define plain read-only register in processor
00211 //
00212 #define VMI_REG_RAW_R(_TP, _F) { \
00213     name   : #_F,                       \
00214     access : vmi_RA_R,                  \
00215     bits   : sizeof(((_TP)0)->_F)*8,    \
00216     raw    : VMI_CPU_REG(_TP, _F)       \
00217 }
00218 
00219 //
00220 // Structure used to pass information about an exception to the debugger
00221 //
00222 typedef struct vmiExceptionInfoS {
00223     const char *name;           // exception name
00224     Uns32       code;           // model-specific exception code
00225     const char *description;    // description string
00226 } vmiExceptionInfo;
00227 
00228 //
00229 // Structure used to pass information about a processor mode to the debugger
00230 //
00231 typedef struct vmiModeInfoS {
00232     const char *name;           // mode name
00233     Uns32       code;           // model-specific mode code
00234     const char *description;    // description string
00235 } vmiModeInfo;
00236 
00237 //
00238 // Function type used to find a processor's type
00239 //
00240 #define VMI_PROC_DESC_FN(_NAME) const char * _NAME( \
00241     vmiProcessorP processor \
00242 )
00243 
00244 typedef VMI_PROC_DESC_FN((*vmiProcDescFn));
00245 
00246 #endif
